As you can see, Andrew Wheeler has stuck very closely to the specific things his coal baron boss asked of the Trump Administration. Incredibly, he told me that he was hearing about some of the items on this list from me today *for the first time.* Really?? https://twitter.com/RepDonBeyer/status/1174725730464337925 …

6) Murray asked Trump's EPA to withdraw the "endangerment finding," EPA analysis that climate change & greenhouse gases endanger American lives. It's the basis for EPA climate action. Wheeler hasn't done that, yet, but his old boss Sen. Inhofe says he may. https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060094933 …

5) Murray wanted Trump's EPA to end the cross-state air pollution rule, known to many as the "good neighbor" rule, which regulates air pollution across state lines. Wheeler didn't repeal it, but has significantly weakened enforcement. We'll call that a "C" https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2019/01/andrew-wheeler-bob-murray-confirmation-hearing/ …

4) Murray told Trump's EPA to eliminate the Maximum Achievable Control Technology (MACT) standards which regulate toxic pollution. Wheeler just proposed a big loophole to allow increases in that pollution. That’s a “B.” https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/trump-mercury-poison-731648/ …

3) Murray gave Trump's EPA the Bond Villain-esque order that "the so-called Clean Power Plan must be eliminated."

Wheeler has been working hard to finish this, I think hi old boss would give him a "B+" https://www.vox.com/2019/6/19/18684054/climate-change-clean-power-plan-repeal-affordable-emissions …

2) Murray asked Trump's EPA to "Withdraw From The Illegal [it isn't illegal] United Nations COP21 Paris Climate Accord."

Trump's EPA made this a high priority, and they did this early in his term. I think Murray would give them an "A+" https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-to-announce-us-will-exit-paris-climate-deal/2017/06/01/fbcb0196-46da-11e7-bcde-624ad94170ab_story.html …

1) Coal baron Bob Murray asked Trump's EPA to "Cut The Staff Of The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency In At Least Half" [sic]

Trump's budget, which Wheeler endorsed, would have cut the EPA by a third, and we blocked that. I gave him an "incomplete." https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/433496-white-house-proposes-dramatic-cuts-to-energy-and-environment …

Deaths by falling are the #4 cause of suicide, and building nets saves lives. Our bill would also authorize a study to find more ways to build barriers to suicide.

As #NationalSuicidePreventionMonth continues, we'll be talking about other ways to help. https://twitter.com/RepDonBeyer/status/1171567277407232000 …

It is important that we have a national conversation about suicide, and a national strategy to address it. CDC data shows that suicides in the United States have risen by a third in the past two decades; over 47,000 Americans took their own lives in 2017. https://www.cdc.gov/vitalsigns/suicide/ …

The basic idea is simple: restricting access to lethal means allows time for a feeling of crisis to pass, and for people experiencing suicidal thoughts to seek help.

Numerous studies back this up, but often state & local governments need help securing funding to build barriers.

Today @RepJohnKatko @gracenapolitano and I introduced the Barriers to Suicide Act.

This bipartisan legislation would create grants for state and local governments to fund nets and barriers on bridges, which studies show really helps #SuicidePrevention.  https://beyer.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=4538 … pic.twitter.com/Lz6D2UBGbV

And we pushed back against yet another handout from the Trump administration to the fossil fuel industry. These bills protect species and help address the blaring alarm bells of the climate crisis. I voted YES.

At a time when global temperatures are steadily rising and the habitats of imperiled species are increasingly under threat, we have protect the health and security of our coastlines.

Congress took a major step today to preserve those coastlines.

Coastal communities, the Pentagon, business leaders, and political leaders from both parties oppose new drilling and seismic blasting.

It threatens fragile marine habitats, including endangered species like the North Atlantic right whale, which is on the brink of extinction.

Good news everyone: the House just passed legislation to block new offshore drilling off the Atlantic and Pacific coasts, and the Gulf of Mexico!
